item.title: Fishing - every 10seconds?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Basicly it has an int that starts at 20. When you click on the appropriate object (what ever u had) it starts the timer. Ever 500ms it checks to see if your int has reached 0 yet. If it has it ads the item to your inventory, and sets the int back to 20. If it isn’t at 0 yet it takes 1 off the int (so 20 = 19, 19 = 18, ect.). Need i say more? lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing - every 10seconds?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

public int fishShrimpTimer = 20;
public void fishShrimp() {
addItem(315, 1);
fishShrimpTimer = 20;
}
public void fishShrimp2() {
if (actionTimer == 0) {
if (playerHasItem(303)) {
if (fishShrimpTimer = 0) {
fishShrimp();
fishShrimp2();
} else {
fishShrimp2();
fishShrimpTimer -= 1);
}
}
case 8986:// Fishing shrimps
fishShrimp2() {
break;

You might have to mess with the brackets and stuff, I’m not good with that stuff

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing - every 10seconds?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Proview, post:1, topic:189170”]How do i make it so you click the fishing spot…then every 10 seconds it gives you a shrimp?

i got this…

case 8986:// Fishing shrimps
if (actionTimer == 0) {
if (playerHasItem(303)) {
addItem(315, 1);
actionTimer = 20;

That adds 1 shrimp when you click if the actiontimer is 0, and sets actiontimer to 20 when u got 1, how do loop that? so it waits untill the timer hits 0, then without cliking the spot again, it get another, then does it again and again and again???

-----Thank you-----[/quote]

no, that means you fish it once, then you have a delay of 10 seconds before you click it again to get another fish (like a mass timer really)

Read full topic
